lines.text:
[after being picked up]
You gotta have more sense than to take chances with strangers like this.
It's funny but practically all the people were strangers when I met them. I'm going to Malibu. Is that any use to you?
What's in Malibu?
Houses, people. I have some friends there.

[walking into the cheap motel]
Clean sheets every day they tell me.
How often do they change the fleas?
Just don't get too complicated, Eddie. When a man gets too complicated, he's unhappy. And when he's unhappy, his luck runs out.
Am I under suspicion?
I don't know. How do you feel about it?

[to the partygoers]
Seems I've lost my manners or would anyone here know the difference?
Hey, you, that's my seat!

[with contempt]
Go pick yourself an orchid!
Well, don't you even say 'Good night'?
It's good-bye, and it's tough to say good-bye.
Why is it? You've never seen me before tonight.
Every guy's seen you before somewhere. The trick is to find you.
I take all the drinks I like, any time, any place. I go where I want to with anybody I want. I just happen to be that kind of a girl.

[discovering his wife in close proximity to Harwood]
You've got the wrong lipstick on, Mister.

[sitting down at the bar with two friends]
Bourbon straight with a bourbon chaser.
Same.
Two separate glasses. Get it?
Why wouldn't I get it?

[examining Helen's body]
Been dead for hours.
Suicide?
Could be.
Better be!
Unh-unh! Too much gun!
I'm sorry, but nothing seems funny to me tonight. It all blows up in your face sometimes.
What does?
Whatever you're doing, whereever you're going.
You still want that room?

[sarcastically]
You sure nobody's dead in it?

[leading him to the room]
Right back this way. You live in San Francisco?

[laconically]
Yeah, when I'm there.
Drink?
Don't mind if I do but easy on the water.
Well, I guess I better be goin', Mr. Harwood.
Wait a minute - you forgot your cigar.
Oh.
I think it's out.

[he lights it]
Cigars go out awful easy, don't they, Dad?

[he blows out his lighter for emphasis]
Good night.

[sitting with Johnny in a convertible in the hills overlooking Los Angeles]
It takes a lot of lights to make a city, doesn't it?
Let me see. I seem to have misplaced your name for he moment.
Where were you keepin' it?
I know I've got lots of faults, but being in love with you isn't one of them, is it?
Half the cops in L.A. are looking for you.
Only half?

[Joyce offers Johnny a lift in the rain]
Get in.
[Johnny hesitates]
Well, you could get wetter if you lie down in the gutter.
